quotes.quote: Being nervous isn't bad. It just means something important is happening.
Every time you go out there, you want to be a little nervous, have a little bit of butterflies in your stomach and get the juices flowing.
Being nervous when talking in front of a lot of people. Sweaty hands, shakey voice, forgetting what your about to say.
Nervousness always provokes mistakes, and mistakes lead to easy convictions.
I'm a very anxious, nervy kind of loser in many ways, and I get very stressed and a little tense.
That nervous feeling when you think about that certain someone and how you're about to see them soon.
Nervous people tend to overreact.
When you feel nervous, recall your pride.
If you're not nervous then you're not paying attention.
One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one's work is terribly important.
To show his nervousness was not shameful; only to admit it.
A well adjusted person is one who makes the same mistake twice without getting nervous.
Most beginners are too anxious for results. Real progress takes place over a long period of time.
Being nervous actually kept me very tense.
The way to secure success is to be more anxious about obtaining than about deserving it.
The sad truth is that excellence makes people nervous.
Time flies when you are anxious!
Butterflies in your stomach. More like killer bees.
Don't try to be what you're not. If you're nervous, be nervous. If you're shy, be shy. It's cute.
The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
To talk to someone who does not listen is enough to tense the devil.
If you're not nervous, it means you don't care.
Being nervous is not something you should be ashamed of. Nervous means you care, you really want to do well.
A nervous silence loosens tongues.
You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
Nervousness made her feel nauseous, almost like she had two hearts frantically beating in her chest, instead of one.
Sometimes when you're just thrown into something, you are more ready for it than when you have time to think it over and get nervous about it.
When you feel afraid or nervous to do a thing then do it because the real harm which you may thus receive is less poignant than its expectation and fear.
A bad liver is to a Frenchman what a nervous breakdown is to an American. Everyone has had one and everyone wants to talk about it.
